text: hi everyone i'm emile stonek editor at
large at bon appetit and this is almost
every way to cook a burger
you can make a burger patty out of just
about anything turkey chicken fish even
plants but when most people think about
a burger they think about beef and the
character of a burger is very much
determined by the cut of beef you use
some people swear by lean sirloin others
by rich fatty short rib and some people
love the full flavor that cuts like
skirt steak offer but for my money it's
all about good old-fashioned chuck
chuck comes from the shoulder of the cow
is super beefy and affordable and
naturally clocks in at about 80 percent
meat and 20 fat exactly what you want
for a burger with tons of flavor and
plenty of juiciness
once the meat is ground it gets gently
formed into a nice tidy six ounce patty
with a little divot in the center to
keep it from shrinking up when it cooks
the biggest challenge when cooking a
burger is getting as much caramelized
crust as possible on the outside while
nailing the perfect juicy medium rare to
medium inside and we're going to try to
do exactly that every way we can think
of
